We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presenter was able to conclude that PRS has high predictive value because of the findings from events 6, 7, and 1. Specifically, event 6 showed that there were over 100 obesity associated loci and some overlapped with genes related to appetite, event 7 highlighted that most common variants only cause minor changes in weight, and event 1 explained the concept of penetrance-frequency quadrants which motivated the use of a polygenic approach.

Therefore, the answer is (C).
